arch:property.oc:show_val: North end W CP East, area of robbed pavers (Tr. 97, 2004, Locus 23).

Phase IV: Nabataean Grand Design: 1st c. BCE to CE 1st c. The full Lower Temenos is constructed, complete with additional subterranean channels and drains, the Hexagonal Pavement, the East and West Triple Colonnades and Cryptoportici, the East and West Exedrae and the Lower Temenos Retaining Wall. East west crosswall is built in the West Cryptoporticus ca. 20 m north of the West Exedra.
1.11 m north south-by-1.60 m east west.

This is a very thin construction fill locus which contains compacted soil ranging in consistency between fine silt to small granules. Its Munsell Color was in the range between 7.5 YR 4/4 (Light Brown) Â– 4/6 (Brown). It served a leveling function between the Loci 16 and 18 terracing courses. There were no inclusions.
